meanings.definition: A public procession, especially one celebrating a special day or event.
meanings.sent1: The parade on Independence Day was filled with colorful floats.
meanings.sent2: The annual Thanksgiving parade featured giant balloons and marching bands.
meanings.sent3: The parade of ducks waddling through the park brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was a parade of vibrant colors that lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The parade of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To walk or march in a public procession.
meanings.sent1: Children love to parade around the house pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers will parade in formation during the military ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to parade in a line, looking like a comical parade.
meanings.sent4: She would parade proudly down the street with her head held high.
meanings.sent5: The dancers will parade gracefully across the stage in the performance.

meanings.definition: To show off or display something in a proud or boastful manner.
meanings.sent1: He would parade his new car in front of his friends to impress them.
meanings.sent2: The peacock would parade its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent3: The chef would parade his culinary skills by creating a masterpiece dish.
meanings.sent4: She would parade her achievements at work to gain recognition.
meanings.sent5: The artist would parade his latest painting at the gallery opening.
